title: Arugula Salad With Beets And Goat Cheese
summary: Arugula Salad With Beets And Goat Cheese might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 1 and costs $2.65 per serving. Watching your figure? This gluten free and vegetarian recipe has 489 calories, 12g of protein, and 41g of fat per serving. This recipe is liked by 263 foodies and cooks. It is brought to you by Simply Recipes. If you have salt and pepper, olive oil, walnuts, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the walnuts you could follow this main course with the Pistachio Cake with Walnuts as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 84%. This score is outstanding. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as Arugula Salad with Beets and Goat Cheese, Roasted Beets With Wild Arugulan And Goat Cheese, and Spinach Salad with Goat Cheese and Beets.
instructions: The amount of ingredients depends on how many people you are serving and how much salad you intend to serve them.  The important thing is that this is a good blend of flavors.  I didn't try tossing this salad; each plate was composed individually.The dressing for three individual salads was 1/4 cup of olive oil, 1/2 lemon, 1/4 teaspoon of powdered mustard, 3/4 teaspoon of sugar, salt and pepper to taste.  Actually, it is all to taste.  These are only approximate measurements.Assemble the salad according to how much you want.  A handful of arugula leaves, a few beet juliennes, some crumbled goat cheese, garnish with chopped walnuts.  Use a vinaigrette salad dressing or what I've described above.

steps.step: The amount of ingredients depends on how many people you are serving and how much salad you intend to serve them.  The important thing is that this is a good blend of flavors.  I didn't try tossing this salad; each plate was composed individually.The dressing for three individual salads was 1/4 cup of olive oil, 1/2 lemon, 1/4 teaspoon of powdered mustard, 3/4 teaspoon of sugar, salt and pepper to taste.  Actually, it is all to taste.  These are only approximate measurements.Assemble the salad according to how much you want.  A handful of arugula leaves, a few beet juliennes, some crumbled goat cheese, garnish with chopped walnuts.  Use a vinaigrette salad dressing or what I've described above.
